definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
at dawn/at first light/first thing in the morning

sentences.english: As early as the "Huang Di Nei Jing" there are records.
sentences.chinese: 早在《黃帝內經》就有記載。

sentences.english: Ihope I didn't wake you up so early.
sentences.chinese: 我盼願這麼早沒有吵到你。

sentences.english: Its age is late Early Triassic.
sentences.chinese: 其時代爲早三疊世晚期。

sentences.english: Thirty-odd years ago, in 1968, some of the stories collected here first appeared in book form.
sentences.chinese: 本書所收故事，一部分早在一九六八年就出了單行本。

sentences.english: And we get to go home early, you know, six o'clock, seven o'clock, latest, you know.
sentences.chinese: 我們還可以早回家，六點，最晚七點。

sentences.english: Ma won a debate competition for Asian college students 22 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 早在22年前，他就贏得“亞洲大專辯論會”的獎盃。

sentences.english: The sun rises late and set early.
At this time, the small grouses drill into the marsh land early in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 這時候，小松雞們早鑽入窪地的積雪裏。

sentences.english: You need not have been here so early , the meeting being at 9o?clock.
sentences.chinese: 你不必那麼早，會議在9點鐘纔開始。

sentences.english: But Taka was already out of his seat and running.
sentences.chinese: 但高井早巳離開座位跑了起來。

sentences.english: Normal range of the pituitary response during early follicular phase was established.
sentences.chinese: 建立了早卵泡期婦女正常反應範圍。

sentences.english: Perhaps you want to document the full scope of your cross-industry experience, much of which occurred in your early career.
sentences.chinese: 或許你更早的一些的工作是在比較有名氣的公司裏。

sentences.english: I financed his initial research and helped him out when times were tough.
sentences.chinese: 我贊助他早初的研究並在困難時刻幫助他。

sentences.english: Early tugboats had steam engines; today diesel engines are used.
sentences.chinese: 早在拖船曾用蒸汽火車頭，今天柴油發動機使用。

sentences.english: Did you come early enough for the chairman's opening speech?
sentences.chinese: 你是早在主席致開幕詞前就來了的嗎？

sentences.english: People back in the 1950s to make the first PV.
sentences.chinese: 人們早在本世紀50年代就製成了第一個光電池。

definition: to wait until/by the time when (sth is ready etc)
to shift to an earlier date/to do sth ahead of time/in advance
to get out of bed/to get up
almost/nearly/more or less/about the same/good enough/not bad
